definition: tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine

sentences.english: The old man was wandering on the streets selling sugarcoated haws on sticks.
sentences.chinese: 賣冰糖葫蘆的老爺爺走街串巷地叫賣。

definition: sugar-coated Chinese hawthorn or other fruit on a stick/tanghulu
food preserved in sugar or honey
jelly snack made by kneading jelly fig seeds 愛玉子|爱玉子[ai4 yu4 zi3] in water and combining with flavorings (popular in Taiwan and Singapore)
soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
ta-a noodles or danzai noodles, popular snack originating from Tainan
imagawayaki (sweet snack made of batter cooked in the shape of a car wheel, stuffed with azuki bean paste or other fillings)
turtle jelly, medicine made with powdered turtle shell and herbs/a similar product made without turtle shell and consumed as a dessert
oden, Japanese dish made with boiled eggs, processed fish cakes, daikon radish, tofu etc in a kelp-based broth
